title: Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar react to India's series whitewash over South Africa
text:
World number one team India thrashed South Africa (Picture: AP)

Sachin Tendulkar and Virat Kohli praised ‘outstanding’ India after their series whitewash over South Africa.

Kohli’s side won the third and final Test in Ranchi by an innings and 202 runs to wrap up an emphatic 3-0 win in the home series against the Proteas.

Rohit Sharma’s stunning double century and a ton from Ajinkya Rahane put India in control in Ranchi, before Umesh Yadav and Mohammed Shami both took five wickets to bowl South Africa twice in less than 105 overs.

India stars celebrate with the trophy (Picture: AP)

The 12th straight home Test win sees India extend their lead at the top of the ICC World Test Championship, having won five successive matches to claim the maximum 240 points.

‘We believe we can win anywhere,’ Kohli said. ‘We’ve wanted to be the best team in Test cricket, and as long as we compete, things will work out well for us.’

The India captain added on social media: ‘So proud of this amazing team and the hard work which is put in day in and day out. Onwards and upwards.’

So proud of this amazing team and the hard work which is put in day in and day out.

Onwards and upwards 💯💪 pic.twitter.com/NRd7A0HmqD — Virat Kohli (@imVkohli) October 22, 2019

Legendary batsman Tendulkar, meanwhile, said: ‘Outstanding display of cricket by India to win the series 3-0.

‘Very good to see all batsmen contribute and the wickets getting shared between the pacers and spinners. Dominating start to the World Test Championship.’

After making 431 in the first innings of the first Test, South Africa endured a poor series with the bat and were bowled out 162 and 133 in the final Test.

Outstanding display of cricket by 🇮🇳 to win the series 3-0. Very good to see all batsmen contribute & the wickets getting shared between the pacers & spinners. Dominating start to the World Test Championship.#INDvSA pic.twitter.com/b21h4SHZ8M — Sachin Tendulkar (@sachin_rt) October 22, 2019

Proteas captain Faf du Plessis said: ‘Every Test, we made more mistakes.

‘But we have to give credit to the Indian team – they were ruthless and they were better than us in every department.’

India face Bangladesh at home in a two-Test series next month, while South Africa host England in December and January.
